thread.title: Jose Canseco says humans need to crush the robot uprising
thread.title_full: Jose Canseco says humans need to crush the robot uprising

author: JAKE BECKER
title: Jose Canseco says humans need to crush the robot uprising
text:
Jose Canseco says humans need to wake up and crush the robot uprising Jose Canseco says humans need to crush the robot uprising Jose Canseco has his eye on the droid danger. (Susan Walsh/AP)   4:55 PM 
Jose Canseco is all juiced up about robots and their existential threat to humanity. 
The steroid-tainted former slugger took a few Twitter swings at the human race’s blatant disregard of the current droid danger that is bringing the world toward an economic catastrophe. 
“The robot threat is being taken to (sic) lightly,” Canseco began on Monday. The robot threat is being taken to lightly — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 
But the 1988 AL MVP warned that the takeover isn’t anything like the Terminator. 
“Robots will not attack and kill us physically like in the movies,” Canseco continued. Robots will not attack and kill us physically like in the movies — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 
“For 60 years Robots have been destroying us in clandestine economy based war started when eniac was turned on.” For 60 years Robots have been systematically destroying us in clandestine economy based war started when eniac was turned on — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 
Canseco went on to order all humans to “wake the f--- up” before sliding into what he thinks is due up for mankind. Already today a fully robotized factory reduces human jobs 90% and increases production 250% and reduces defects 80% while doubling profit — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 Robots control every industry our food supply our transportation systems our health care and education systems EVERYTHING — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 robots are stealing our jobs bringing economic ruin to us human by human starving us to death one by one — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 All that will be left is uber technical humans trained to service robots. — Jose Canseco (@JoseCanseco) February 20, 2017 
Ballplayers, however, seem to be immune to the bionic outbreak. Tags:
